message:
Hi everyone.

This macbook does not work the keyboard illuminator, I see that in the system preferences it does not detect it.

I tried another plate of the same model 820-01521 in the case and if it is detected by the lighting in the system preferences and when I press the keys it lowers and raises the lighting without problem.

So I know it's a motherboard problem.

In the J6700 connector I made measurements of the Diode with the good board and I only have two altered values

"PDM_DMIC_DATA0_ISOL"
"PDM_DMIC_DATA1_ISOL"

I think this is from the microphone, I tried it and the microphone works.

PP5V_G3S_IPD_F : 5.1v

PP3V3_G3H_IPD_F: 3.3v

PP3V3_G3S_IPD_F: 3.3v

Am I forgetting something?

ALS is associated with webcam; both have the same power rail, 5V_ALSCAM.
And KB backlight cannot work if ALS doesn't work.
Check first 5V presence at C8577; is the webcam working?
Also check if LCD backlight varies when you direct flashlight on the webcam.
I just opened the camera and it works correctly
What about ALS function???
ALS?
you mean the ambient light sensor, ok when covering the camera on the screen with your finger or hand, it does not show brightness either.

LCD backlight reacts?
If not, check ALS_SCL/SDA lines/resistors on the MLB.
yes, it lowers and raises the brightness from the keyboard without problem.

You didn't understand me.
When you put more, or less light on webcam (ALS), LCD backlight should be automatically adjusted.
If not, you have a problem with ALS (on MLB); of course, KB backlight will be disabled in such case.
You say that when I cover the camera the brightness should go down right?
Yes, LCD brightness must react; not going black, just decreasing.

i2c_ALS_SCL 1.8V
i2c_ALS_SDA 1.8V

ok I did the following test, put the functional board and put the iphone light on the camera and turn off the brightness of the keyboard, the board that I am repairing does not do the same, then the ALS is damaged, then where is the integrated one that controls ? T2? because 1.8v voltages go to T2

I said to check LCD (screen) brightness reaction.
You have a problem with KB backlight, can't use it for test; as you never get it on.
I did the test and nothing, there is no low brightness reaction when covering the camera
"check ALS_SCL/SDA lines/resistors on the MLB."
1.8V both
Did you change the small video cable?
the LCD one, of course.
I talk about small cable connected on J8500 (MLB).

I know which one you mean, the one connected in the J8500 to the LCD pcb.

I changed it and it's still the same.

They changed the keyboard on this machine, the strange thing is that I tried another board on the same base and it works.

Could it be a BIOS issue?

T2 machine, you can't touch BIOS there.

If you are now sure is ALS issue, need to check continuity on its SCL/SDA lines.
Also check R8556/58.

those lines have continuity from end to end.

both from the resistors to the J8500 connector and from the resistors to the capacitors.

Values in diode 521 both lines

33 ohms in both

Try DFU revive, just in case.
If no important data, you can go for restore directly.
You won't believe me but I already did it, I restored T2 and nothing... :(
Maybe some contact problem in J8500.

well this case left me unsolved but I'll be waiting if another one arrives, deliver the equipment like this.

I reflowed the lcd connector on the motherboard, I think maybe one of the pins was not making contact, I would have changed it. But good for next time. Thanks for your help [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]

Be sure that you've diagnosed ALS correctly.
Because if ALS is good, the problem remains hidden on the MLB...
